newsitem.title: USA: Gilead, Hoffmann-La Roche in Roferon pact.
newsitem.headline: Gilead, Hoffmann-La Roche in Roferon pact.

text.p: Hoffmann-La Roche Inc and Gilead Sciences Inc said Monday they have entered a collaboration to co-promote Roche's Roferon-A for the potential treatment of chronic hepatitis C in the United States.

Hoffmann-La Roche said it is waiting for clearance to market Roferon-A as a treatment for chronic hepatitis C. The company said it is currently marketing the product in the United States for treating several types of cancer.
Hoffmann-La Roche is a unit of Roche Holding Ltd.
Gilead's co-promotion rights will be limited to the product's use in treating hepatitis C, if and when approval is obtained, the companies said.

Under the agreement, Roche would pay Gilead a percentage of overall product net sales for the hepatitis C indication in each of the three years of the collaboration. It would also give Gilead a residual payment after completion of the co-promotion arrangement, the companies said.
